questions.text: Which of the following presidents had a pet racoon?
questions.explanation:
Coolidge.

	He actually had two racoons named Rebecca and Horace, along with dogs, cats, birds, a donkey, a bobcat, lion cubs, a pygmy hippo and a bear.

questions.text: Where did the 'Cyclone' rollercoaster make its debut in 1927?
'Thimble Theater' was a cartoon strip that introduced which character in 1928?
questions.explanation:
Popeye.

	It was drawn by Elzie Crisler Segar and ran until 1938.

questions.text: In 1927 NBC launched a second network to go with its red network.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was called the blue network. It was forced to give one up to prevent a monopoly. It became the ABC.

questions.text: The tradition of lighting the White House Christmas tree began in the twenties under which president?
questions.explanation:
Coolidge.

	The first one at the White House was lit in 1923. The first lighted Christmas tree in public was in Boston in 1912.

questions.text: The 1924 film 'The Thief Of Baghdad' starred which male actor?
questions.explanation:
Douglas Fairbanks.

	This early movie was directed by Raoul Walsh.

questions.text: Who was the manager of the 1927 New York Yankees?
questions.explanation:
Miller Huggins.

	Miller Huggins managed from 1918-1929, McCarthy from 1931-1945 and Stengel from 1949-1960. McGraw was never a manager of the Yankees.

questions.text: Where did the Rif War take place in the 1920s?
questions.explanation:
Morocco.

	It ran from 1921-1926. The Rifians were a tribe that captured Morocco massacring 16,000 soldiers.

questions.text: Primo de Rivera became the dictator of which country in September 1923?
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	At the request of King Alfonso the thirteenth he established a military dictatorship.

questions.text: The Hertz rental car system originated in Frankfurt, Germany.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It started in Chicago in 1923.
